oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Food safety in an organic perspective
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kristensen, Erik Steen
Alrøe, Hugo Fjelsted
Hansen, Birgitte
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Values, standards and certification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The holistic perspective of organic farming implies a broader conception of food safety that includes both product safety and agri-food system safety. The credibility of organic food can only be maintained if the organic agri-food system is developed in correspondence with the basic organic principles. In this way it will be possible to show the whole organic agri-food system as a safer alternative to conventional farming. Thereby trust will be supported in organic foods despite the sparse (and often unattainable) hard scientific evidence that organic food is healthier.
